The Ardb team are volonteers and are not willing to ties themselves to timeline constraint. So stuff will be released when it's done! (TM) [http://www.rasterman.com/ rasterman] :D. 

So don't ask for a release date, as each such question will delay actual [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_release_life_cycle#Gold_or_general_availability_release the GA]

We nonetheless *have* a roadmap.

= Ardb-v2.0 =
The first release of the new Ardb Team Ardb-v2.0 serie will be a major bugfix release of the last of Fran√ßois G stable release.

== Brand new in this release ==
We plan to fix all knowned issues that lies in the Ardb codebase.

Ardb-v2.0 will introduce the following new featues:
  * Card Browser image panel [http://code.google.com/p/ardb/issues/detail?id=3 ENH-03]
  * Improved Deck Statistics [http://code.google.com/p/ardb/issues/detail?id=5 ENH-05]

You can see all issues of Ardb-v2.0 [http://code.google.com/p/ardb/issues/list?can=1&q=milestone%3AArdb2&colspec=ID+Type+Milestone+Status+Priority+Owner+Summary+Modified&cells=tiles here]

= Ardb-v3.0 =
Ardb-v3.0 will introduce new feature and major codebase refactoring.

== Brand new in this release ==
  * New UI Layout
  * Improved Deck Builder Statistics
  * Dik the stupid Deck Builder Helper
  * More export format
  * Refactored Vtes Set Selector
  * Print capability for Card Browser Result Set
  * New Updater codebase
  * New Database Layout

You can see all issues of Ardb-v3.0 [http://code.google.com/p/ardb/issues/list?can=1&q=milestone%3AArdb3&colspec=ID+Type+Milestone+Status+Priority+Owner+Summary+Modified&cells=tiles here]
